To His Excellency, Governor Roy L. Cochran: We respectfully submit the summary of , business of companies authorized to -write insurance in this State for the year ending December 31, 1936. DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE, : C. SMRHA, Director.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES REINSURING, MERGING, OR WITHDRAWING FROM JANUARY 1, 1936 TO JUNE 1, 1937 Acacia Mutual Life Insurance Company, Washington, D. C. Withdrew as of December 31, 193 6. American Annuity Assurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Reinsured by American States Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, February 18, 1937. American Central Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis, Indiana. Merged with United Mutual Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis, Indiana, and changed name to American United Life Insurance Com - pany, December 17, 1936. American Lloyds Mutual Assurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Dis - solved in 1936. American Plate Glass Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Inactive. American Travelers Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Inactive. Associated Fire and Marine Insurance Company, San Francisco, Cali - fornia. Withdrew as of April 30, 1937. Atlas Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Reinsured by the World Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, March 1, 1937. Atlas Mutual Insurance Company, Kansas City, Missouri. Placed in the hands of the Missouri State Insurance Department for rehabilita - tion early in 19 37. Catholic Union of Daughters of Columbus, Omaha, Nebraska. Merged with Catholic Workman, New Prague, Minnesota, December 31, 1936. Cedar Rapids Life Insurance Company, Cedar Rapids, Iowa. Rein - sured by the United Benefit Life Insurance Company, Omaha, Ne - braska, December 31, 1936. Equitable Fire Underwriters, Kansas City, Missouri. Withdrew as of March 5, 1936. Federal Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Boston, Massachusetts. With - drew as of April 30, 1936. Fltchburg Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Fitchburg, Massachusetts. Withdrew as of April 30, 193 7. Inland Casualty Company, Hamilton, Ohio. Withdrew as of April 30, 1936. Inter-Insurers Exchange, Kansas City, Missouri. Consolidated with Underwriters Exchange, Kansas City, Missouri, December 31, 1936. Manufacturing Lumbermen's Underwriters, Kansas City, Missouri. Placed in receivership in 19 36. Midland Casualty Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Liquidated as of April 26. 1937. Missouri Valley National Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Liquidated. Mutual Casualty Company of Chicago, Incorporated, Chicago, Illinois. Reinsured by Alliance Life Insurance Company, Peoria, Illinois, April 17, 1937. National Aid Life Insurance Company, Springfield, Illinois. Reinsured by Central Life Insurance Company of Illinois, Chicago, Illinois, June 1, 1936. Norwich Union Indemnity Company, New York, N. Y. Withdrew as of April 30, 1936. Old Line Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Inactive. Sussex Fire Insurance Company, Newark, New Jersey. Withdrew as of April 30, 1937. Traders & General Insurance Company, Dallas, Texas. Withdrew as of April 30, 1936. Union National Fire Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska. Dissolved as of February 19, 1937. United Mutual Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis, Indiana. Merged with American Central Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis, In - diana, and changed name to American United Life Insurance Com - pany, December 17, 1936.

NEBRASKA INSURANXE REPORT COMPANIES CHANGING NAME OB PLAN American Central Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis, Indiana, merged with United Mutual Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis Indiana, and changed name to American United Life Insurance Company, December 31, 1936. American States Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed name to American Annuity Assurance Company, February 18, 1937. Cornbelt Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed name to Woodmen Central Life Insurance Company, August 10, 1936. Farmers Mutual Insurance Company of York County, York, Nebraska, changed name to York County Farmers Mutual Insurance Company January 11, 1936. Federated Merchants Mutual Insurance Company, Omaha Nebraska changed name to Farmers Union Fidelity Insurance' Company' Grand Island, Nebraska, February 27, 1936. German Farmers Mutual Fire Association of York County, Hampton Nebraska, changed name to The German Farmers Mutual Insur - ance Company yf York County, December 29, 1936. Harmonia Fire Insurance Company, Buffalo, New York, changed name to The Paul Revere Fire Insurance Company, March 5, 193 7. Home Mutual Insurance Association, Des Moines, Iowa, changed name to Home Mutual Insurance Company of Iowa, and changed plan from assessment fire to mutual fire, February 1, 1937. Knox County Farmers Mutual Whirlwind & Tornado Insurance Com - pany of Nebraska, Bloomfield, Nebraska, changed name to Farmers Mutual Whirlwind & Tornado Insurance Company of Knox Countv February 4, 19 36. «"»vjt The Pacific Mutual Life Insurance Company of California, Los Angeles California changed name to Pacific Mutual Life Insurance Company, July bA| j .' . i b . Royal Highlanders, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed plan from fraternal beneficiary society to Mutual Legal Reserve Life.
